intro: Trachycalymma minutiflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered trachycalymma, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. The plant is native to Australia and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought-resistant growth.
